TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
How 'bout my new SP-15?

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/160226-sp-15/&do=embed"></iframe>

Im going to create a linter <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">ssto</abbr>

lighter

> 
> 
> On December 19, 2016 at 1:02 PM, tseitsei89 said:
> 
> 
> <iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4xNRG2lmKXc?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>
> 
> 
> 
> I don't like losing
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [http://imgur.com/a/YfG2R](http://imgur.com/a/YfG2R)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> shot 836kg ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")
> 

woop 834 kg!! I did it!

From top to bottom its a:

Small Circular intake

Small Inline Reaction Wheel

Probodobyne QBE, <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> Chip, Mk12 radial mount parachute  

Mk0 Liquid Fuel Fuselage, Z400 battery bank x4 Z-100 Battery bank x1

Juno Jet engine.

The whole thing is a bit smaller than the Nerv Atomic engine.

heheheh ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif ":sticktongue:")

Hey [@ccoel](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/177405-ccoel/), what are the fuel levels?

Also, NO ROCKET!? How can you get about 25000m with a Juno <u>JET</u> engine?

Also also, can we have a picture of it?

Also also also, 4 Z400s sounds like a waste.

Also also also also, no wings?

Also also also also also, I'm surprised by the lack of activity in this forum.

So I quickly put all the parts together, and without reduced fuel levels or the "<abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> Chip", it weighs 0.84t.

![pFpsCYA.png](http://i.imgur.com/pFpsCYA.png)

The radial parts create too much drag, even when clipped (because physicsless parts rules), during flight. BS detector detected positive.

Yeah same. And I don't even have the <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> chip.

Ok. A <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> chip is apart of the Kerbal Inventory System mod. Now, I don't know if it affects mass, aerodynamics and all that, but would does a <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> chip benefit?

I think that's a typo -- <abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr> chip (for the engineer display), not <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> chip (which doesn't exist).

It's dead simple:

1. Get a Mun encounter while you are still in the athmosphere on jet power

2. Achieve orbit by gravity assist

3. Figure out how to deorbit w/o orbital maneuvers ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I don't buy the Juno jet story either though ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") 

Edit: This would actually be a fun challenge but it's impossible with stock engines...

Congratulations to...

[@JoeNapalm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/67032-joenapalm/) [JoeNapalm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3039555) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Vampire Mk1 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.

[@JYNg](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/165975-jyng/) [JYNg](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3041187) Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with Kaiser 4.

[@Skylon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/175317-skylon/) [Skylon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3042616) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with STP-2 'Javelin' Trainer Spaceplane.

[@EliteGuy3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163454-eliteguy3/)- with [Corinthians I](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3044337).

... for completing the K-Prize mission succesfully. Thankyou for your mission reports and welcome to the roll of honour aka the very exclusive K-Prize party guest list.

[@Joseph Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/176176-joseph-kerman/) nice looking craft but you need to make a mission report of some kind for us to know that you did the mission. Same goes for your report [@ccoel](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/177405-ccoel/) which does not state that your craft completed a mission and given the objections above I will wait for your reply.

[@Fulgora](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/172132-fulgora/) If you think about it using infinite fuel does count as refuelling so its a gatecrasher without a doubt but thanks for your honest report and if you are OK with it I will link it on the front page among other gatecrashers and other missions of infamy. Though I should also add that launching from a gantry has been done before and that was also a gatecrasher because the launch trajectory was not horizontal, as due to physics the craft dips on release no matter how powerful the engine if it is launched horizontally in mid air and not angled up. If you want to use that launch method then it has to meet the rules and plausibly launch horizontally, which would be all the more plausible if there was some graphical evidence to show how it works. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") You can expunge your gatecrasher if you so choose by completing the mission successfully.

The deorbit was legit though - so all the infinite fuel did was saving me 20 minutes of physics warp buuut anyways, back to the drawing board ;-)

>

> Also, [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/), you should probably mention how gantries cause clipping and misalignment A.K.A no launch clamps.
> 

No gantries whatsoever? O.o

Not even for stabilizing the craft at load and getting a kerbal in?

The rules have the simple intent of creating a level playing field for comparison of reusable spaceplane designs.

As far as I can see, clipping and alignment wouldn't break any of the K-Prize rules as long as they do not produce a kraken drive effect.

The stipulation about horizontal takeoff is to encourage spaceplane development as opposed to rocket (as is the no decoupling rule). 

With gantries, re decoupling, its much the same case as loading kerbals into a flight chair prior to lift off and dropping the command pod, they do not count as part of the craft and if you can find a way to launch horizontally using a gantry then fair is fair and ingenuity is always interesting.

[@EliteGuy3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163454-eliteguy3/) [@Fulgora](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/172132-fulgora/) ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")
